text: hi i wa wondering if anyone ha this happen to them i have have had depression for decade i have good day and bad day no period that last for week or month like i did when i first started having symptom 0 year ago thank god it is mostly occasional bad bout most often i just have a dull low depression that i can dell with using moving muscle using cognitive dispute today i had one of the rare event that i used to get often i wake up early have a cup or two of coffee yet i feel really exhausted i slept fine the night before i end up having breakfast but that exhausted feeling becomes overwhelming and i go back to bet by 9am the entire day consists of me sleeping having lucid bat shit crazy bizarre dream the dream are not nightmare in fact they are rather creative but the local and situation are like the came from somebody imagination in a distant galaxy they would make really interesting sci fi fantasy i also dream about being lonely i have no family few friend one thing i remember wa this gut wrenching sadness about a girl i dated over 0 year ago thought she wa the one but it fell apart after about 0 to hour i get up have something to eat i feel hung over an d it is like a storm passed through my brain spent it s energy and now calm ha returned i wa wondering if anyone else had had similar experience like this it would be concerning if it wa a frequent occurrence which it once wa in the early day of depression again that wa decade ago thanks in advance for any observation or comment peace
explanation:

The individual describes a long-standing history of depression, indicating a chronic condition. While they report periods of manageable "dull low depression," the described episode is more severe. The experience of overwhelming exhaustion despite adequate sleep, the need to return to bed, and the vivid, bizarre dreams (including those related to loneliness and past relationship loss) suggest a significant impact on their daily functioning and emotional state. The "gut-wrenching sadness" related to a past relationship, even after many years, points to unresolved emotional pain. While the individual notes that these severe episodes are now infrequent, the intensity and impact of the described experience warrant a moderate depression rating. The text also highlights a reliance on coping mechanisms ("moving muscle," "cognitive dispute"), suggesting an ongoing effort to manage depressive symptoms.

text: i now think about suicide constantly i feel like it is my only option in the long term i will never finish school and be able to hold down a job i will never be able to be stable enough to give my wife child i can t live up to anything anyone expects of me i am stuck though my death would be a catastrophe in my wife s life and my brother s life and i have a few friend who would be devastated a well also and i really hate to say this but the biggest reason i can t is because i can t leave my dog with anyone else he is very attached to me and no one else and would be very unhappy without me so i am stuck i can t function despite 0 year of trying medication and therapy i have no will to live except not to hurt people around me i hate this

*   **Feelings of Worthlessness/Failure:** The statement "I can't live up to anything anyone expects of me" indicates a deep sense of inadequacy and failure.
*   **Loss of Interest/Motivation:** The individual states "I have no will to live," demonstrating a profound lack of motivation and enjoyment in life.
*   **Acknowledges Impact on Others BUT Remains Suicidal:** While the individual recognizes the potential negative impact of their death on loved ones (including their dog), this concern is not enough to override their suicidal ideation and feelings of hopelessness. This further emphasizes the severity of their depression.
*   **Treatment Resistance:** The text mentions "0 year of trying medication and therapy" which implies that the patient has tried treatment options and it has not worked indicating this patient may have treatment resistant depression.

The constellation of these symptoms, particularly the active and persistent suicidal ideation, warrants a rating of severe depression.

text: i am told that my perfectionism is unproductive and unrealistic that i can not perform excellently on every task i set to that this is no reason to panic and consider the worst and yet the world itself is perfection obsessed we applaud prodigy exclude people who don t perform perfectly from higher academic program idolise perfect work i can t bear it these thought are not just figment of my imagination they are very real and true i can t just dismiss them because they are uncomfortable
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators suggestive of moderate depression:

*   **Negative Thought Patterns:** The individual displays a tendency towards negative and rigid thinking ("consider the worst," "I can't bear it"). They are struggling with perceived failures and feel overwhelmed by the pressure to achieve perfection.
*   **Sense of Hopelessness/Helplessness:** The individual feels trapped by the pressure to be perfect due to what they feel is societal pressure to achieve perfection.
*   **Emotional Distress:** The statement "I can't bear it" indicates a significant level of emotional distress and an inability to cope with their thoughts and feelings.
*   **Self-Criticism:** While not explicitly stated, the underlying tone suggests a harsh self-assessment based on not meeting perceived standards of perfection.

These factors combined suggest a level of depression that is more than just mild, but not yet exhibiting the profound despair or functional impairment associated with severe or extreme depression. The individual is clearly suffering and struggling with their thoughts, but further assessment would be needed to determine the full extent of their depression and its impact on their daily life.

text: doe anyone else feel this way too during an attack it will come on like a rush out of nowhere no trigger that i m feeling for instance whenever i go to like target or walmart i tend to get this it s almost like an overwhelming feeling and feeling faint i never seem to be able to finish my shopping fully due to this because i just want to go checkout a soon a this wave come on i hate this so much
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text suggests moderate depression due to the following factors:

*   **Anxiety and Panic Symptoms:** The description of "an attack" that comes "like a rush out of nowhere" with physical symptoms like feeling faint indicates panic or anxiety, which are commonly comorbid with depression.
*   **Avoidance Behavior:** The individual avoids completing shopping trips ("never seem to be able to finish my shopping fully") due to these attacks. Avoidance is a common coping mechanism for anxiety and depression, but it can also reinforce negative feelings and limit one's life.
*   **Negative Affect:** The statement "I hate this so much" demonstrates negative emotions and a sense of distress related to the attacks.
*   **Contextual Triggers:** While the individual states there's "no trigger that I'm feeling," the association with specific locations like Target or Walmart suggests a possible environmental trigger or conditioned response. This warrants further exploration.

While the text doesn't explicitly mention sadness, hopelessness, or other hallmark symptoms of depression, the presence of anxiety, avoidance, and negative affect, alongside the impact on daily functioning, points towards a moderate level of distress that warrants further assessment for depression and anxiety disorders.

text: suicidal all weekend watched the infamous funky town gore video i m usually ok with gore and death but that wa horrific made me think could that be me in hell for eternity i mean if human could do something that drawn out and horrific there s no telling what would be in store down there and all because i couldn t handle the cruelty of human nature
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This text excerpt demonstrates several indicators of severe depression:

*   **Suicidal Ideation:** The explicit mention of being "suicidal all weekend" is a critical red flag. This indicates a serious level of distress and potential risk.
*   **Hopelessness/Pessimism:** The preoccupation with "hell for eternity" and the belief that such horrific suffering could be one's fate reveals a deep sense of hopelessness and a negative outlook on the future. The individual is catastrophizing and imagining the worst possible outcome.
*   **Anhedonia/Loss of Interest:** The fact that the individual, who is "usually ok with gore and death," was profoundly disturbed by the video suggests a heightened sensitivity and vulnerability, potentially stemming from a depressive state. Things that once held a certain level of indifference are now profoundly disturbing.
*   **Existential Angst:** The questioning of the nature of human cruelty and the fear of eternal suffering reflect a deep existential angst. This suggests a struggle with meaning and purpose in life, often associated with depression.
*   **Intense Negative Emotions:** The use of words like "horrific," "cruelty," and the overall tone of despair indicate the presence of intense negative emotions that are overwhelming the individual.

text: gavlp yes i hope these shock are going to stop soon i think i m getting angry with earth itself
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators suggestive of moderate depression:

*   **Hopelessness:** The statement "I hope these shocks are going to stop soon" suggests a passive desire for relief from unpleasant experiences, hinting at a lack of control and a sense of being overwhelmed.
*   **Anger and Irritability:** "I think I'm getting angry with earth itself" points to a potential increase in irritability and displaced anger. This can be a symptom of depression, where negative emotions become amplified and generalized.
*   **Apathy:** The fact that the anger is directed towards "earth itself" can be seen as an expression of extreme apathy.

text: joannafbeckett i don t think there s one close by last time i checked the closest one wa 0 mile away

However, the use of "I don't think" *could* suggest a hint of negativity or a slightly pessimistic outlook. This, combined with the fact that the individual is posting on a mental health forum (presumably seeking support), leads me to lean towards a rating of mild depression. More information is needed for a more accurate assessment.

text: i have been suffering for eight long month after a girl i thought would be interested in being my girlfriend ended thing and left me out to dry it wa a pretty short span of dating and hooking up we talked during the summer and only saw each other in person for a few week but the aftermath ha been the worst thing i ve ever gone through in my entire life i have alienated myself from her because i couldn t stop texting her and asking what i did wrong or saying thing i thought i did to make her not interested and expect her to confirm i am on a no contact basis with her now which is probably for the best because i don t think she even cared that much about me to begin with i can t handle the fluidity of dating how people can just leave something if it isn t working out for them for whatever reason and not know what that reason is i ve already come up with every possible situation or reason in my head that it didn t work out and it s honestly been driving me over the edge since last summer i can t take this anymore luckily it s never gotten so bad that i threatened her with suicide because i remember her saying she had an ex who did that to her and it sound like an awful thing to have done to you but that thought did cross my mind where i wanted to present that a an ultimatum to her if she couldn t just tell me what the exact reason or reason were she wanted to end it but i would never actually do that due to it being shitty to put another person through it s not enough for me to accept that we lived more than three hour from each other or she had a bad long term relationship end and wasn t trying to get into anything serious or she told me she wa feeling suffocated by me it s like the spongebob episode with patrick s secret box i just want so badly to hear what it might have been like she would tell her girl friend behind closed door no matter how bad it might sting or hurt but i know i ll never know precisely what she wa thinking it is so difficult to just move on or let it go like people always say for dating situation like this that to me just sound impossible i just hate dating i hate how some people have such ease jumping from date to date or going on multiple date with multiple people at once or talking to many people at one time it just make me feel so overwhelmed and upset that that seems to be the norm in society i can t take it it make me want to die just knowing that s what i m going to have to deal with if i want to have any hope of finding someone to be with let alone get over this last girl
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text demonstrates several indicators of severe depression:

*   **Prolonged Duration:** The individual has been suffering for eight months, indicating a persistent and chronic state of distress.
*   **Intense Emotional Pain:** The language used ("worst thing I've ever gone through," "driving me over the edge," "I can't take this anymore") conveys a high level of emotional pain and suffering.
*   **Self-Isolation:** The individual mentions alienating themselves from the former partner, which can be a sign of withdrawal and difficulty maintaining relationships.
*   **Rumination and Obsessive Thoughts:** The repeated analysis of the breakup ("every possible situation or reason," "Spongebob episode with Patrick's secret box") indicates rumination and an inability to let go of negative thoughts.
*   **Hopelessness and Despair:** The statement "I can't take it. It makes me want to die just knowing that's what I'm going to have to deal with" expresses a sense of hopelessness and a desire to escape the situation, suggesting suicidal ideation.
*   **Negative Worldview:** The individual expresses a strong aversion to dating and societal norms, perceiving them as overwhelming and upsetting. This negative worldview contributes to feelings of despair and hopelessness.
*   **Suicidal thoughts:** Though fleeting, the individual admits to thoughts of using suicide as an ultimatum. This, coupled with the desire to die, is a serious indicator of severity.

While the individual recognizes the inappropriateness of using suicide as a manipulation tactic, the presence of such thoughts, coupled with the other symptoms, suggests a significant level of distress and impaired functioning, thus pointing toward severe depression.

text: for some reason i have a strong urge to draw illustration for novel cover
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The statement expresses a desire to engage in a creative activity (drawing illustrations). This suggests some level of motivation and interest, which is not typically associated with moderate to severe depression, where anhedonia (loss of interest or pleasure) is a core symptom. The phrase "for some reason" might indicate a slight disconnect or questioning of the urge, but it's not strong enough to indicate significant distress. Therefore, a rating of 1 (Mild Depression) is most appropriate. The person is exhibiting some mild signs that could be related to depression, but there is not enough information to rate them as having moderate, severe, or extreme depression.

text: ughhhhhhhhhh twitter is bing sooooo retarded
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text expresses a negative sentiment ("ughhhhhhhhhh," "retarded") and a general sense of frustration or annoyance. While not explicitly stating feelings of sadness, hopelessness, or worthlessness, the overall tone suggests a low mood and potentially a lack of interest or pleasure (anhedonia) in online interactions. The use of elongated "ughhhhhhhhhh" indicates a heightened emotional state, but the content is limited and doesn't provide enough information to suggest a more severe level of depression. Therefore, a rating of 1 (Mild Depression) seems appropriate.

text: i just spent a good half of my morning trying to convince myself to get up and go to class how it is unbelievably stupid that i wa and had been skipping all the class just to lay around in bed practically doing nothing how my parent and relative would be disappointed that their money is being wasted on me me who don t know what i want to do have no idea why i m even still breathing all these good reason to get up and brush my teeth and go to class and i just pulled my blanket over my head and wait till it wa too late god why am i like this
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators of severe depression:

*   **Loss of Motivation and Apathy:** The individual expresses significant difficulty getting out of bed and attending class, despite recognizing the negative consequences (wasting money, disappointing family). This points to a loss of interest and motivation, core symptoms of depression.
*   **Negative Self-Perception and Worthlessness:** The individual demonstrates strong feelings of worthlessness ("don't know what I want to do," "no idea why I'm even still breathing"), self-blame ("why am I like this"), and guilt about perceived failures. These are common cognitive distortions associated with depression.
*   **Hopelessness:** The inability to overcome inertia despite recognizing the logical reasons to get up and attend class suggests a deep sense of hopelessness and helplessness.
*   **Avoidance:** Pulling the blanket over their head is a clear sign of avoidance, a maladaptive coping mechanism used to escape overwhelming feelings.

The combination of these factors, particularly the intensity of the negative self-perception and the sense of hopelessness, indicates a severe level of depression.

text: finishing the tax return instead of making some track or enjoying the sun
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The statement indicates a loss of interest in activities that would normally be enjoyable ("making some track," "enjoying the sun"). This suggests anhedonia, a core symptom of depression. The individual is choosing a less pleasant, obligatory task ("finishing the tax return") over enjoyable activities, which may reflect a sense of obligation or difficulty experiencing pleasure. The phrasing implies a conflict between what they *should* be doing and what they *want* to be doing, further hinting at a depressive state affecting motivation and enjoyment. While not overtly expressing hopelessness or despair, the clear preference for a chore over leisure suggests a more than mild level of depressive symptoms.

text: dang i m lazy i ve begun three short story in the last three week and never finished anything will have more focus
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits a few indicators that suggest mild depression:

*   **Lack of motivation and inertia ("I'm lazy"):** This statement points to a potential loss of interest or drive, a common symptom of depression.
*   **Difficulty completing tasks ("begun three short story in the last three week and never finished anything"):** This suggests a problem with concentration, follow-through, and a potential sense of frustration or failure, which can be associated with depression.
*   **Hope for improvement ("will have more focus"):** While the individual acknowledges a problem, they express a desire for improvement. This suggests they are not entirely hopeless, which is more indicative of mild rather than severe depression.

The overall tone is relatively mild. There's no mention of suicidal thoughts, overwhelming sadness, or significant changes in appetite or sleep, which would suggest a higher level of depression. The statement about wanting more focus indicates some self-awareness and a desire to improve, pointing towards a less severe presentation.

text: want her ipod
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This single phrase, "want her ipod," provides virtually no information to assess for depression. It expresses a desire for an object, which is a normal human experience. There is no indication of sadness, hopelessness, loss of interest, or any other symptoms associated with depression. Therefore, a rating of 0 is most appropriate.

text: i hate it when people cheer me on or encourage me or anything uplifting at all it hard to believe that they are genuinely saying that and not just saying it out of pity and just to be nice for example when i wa younger i hated being cheered on during race or competition even though i wa so far behind it felt horrible miserable and i wa furious i felt like fighting whoever cheered me on whenever people try to say something uplifting it just seems like they are being nice if you are saying something just to be nice it mean it not true and they feel bad for u idk if this is a personal thing but i just wan na know if anybody else can relate
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators suggestive of moderate depression:

*   **Anhedonia/Loss of Interest:** The individual expresses a strong aversion to encouragement and uplifting statements, suggesting a potential inability to experience pleasure or benefit from positive social interactions. This is a key symptom of depression.
*   **Negative Interpretation Bias:** The individual automatically interprets positive affirmations as insincere and motivated by pity. This negative bias in thinking is a common cognitive symptom of depression. They assume the worst intentions in others and discount any potential genuine goodwill.
*   **Feelings of Worthlessness/Self-Esteem Issues:** The belief that people are "just being nice" and "feel bad for you" points to underlying feelings of low self-worth and a sense of being inadequate.
*   **Irritability/Anger:** The expressed "fury" and desire to "fight" those who cheer them on, while specific to the context of encouragement, indicates a possible underlying irritability or emotional dysregulation that can be associated with depression.
*   **Social Discomfort/Isolation:** The individual seems to have a hard time accepting that people are genuinely encouraging them and also makes them want to seek out if there are other people that can relate to their issues.
While the text doesn't explicitly mention sadness, hopelessness, or other hallmark symptoms, the constellation of negative interpretation, aversion to positive reinforcement, and underlying self-esteem issues warrants a moderate depression rating. A more comprehensive assessment would be needed to confirm a diagnosis.

text: i keep thinking that i m only putting all this effort in for someone else because i love her and i don t want to hurt her and i enjoy being with her and how she make me feel but i also want to get better so i can be in a better place to be more supportive for her and my peer i m trying to live for myself and not others but i m not sure where i am with that
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text suggests a mild level of depression for the following reasons:

*   **Lack of Self-Focus:** The individual expresses a primary motivation for self-improvement that is linked to supporting others ("because I love her...to be more supportive for her"). This suggests a diminished sense of self-worth or agency, relying on external validation or purpose.
*   **Uncertainty and Confusion:** The phrase "I'm not sure where I am with that" indicates a lack of clarity regarding personal goals and identity, which is common in depression.
*   **Effort and Struggle:** The statement "I keep thinking that I'm only putting all this effort in..." suggests a conscious struggle to find intrinsic motivation and purpose, which can be mentally taxing and indicative of a depressive mood.
*   **Limited Negative Affect:** While the text doesn't express overt hopelessness or despair, the focus on external motivation and the uncertainty about personal goals point towards a subdued mood and potential difficulty experiencing joy or satisfaction in personal pursuits.

The text doesn't indicate the severity of symptoms (e.g., suicidal ideation, significant functional impairment) that would warrant a higher rating. The individual is still actively trying to improve and maintain relationships, which suggests some level of resilience and engagement with life.

text: my computer can t open any file from the university so i can t do any work i don t get it

text: tbh i just have no one to talk to and really need input atm i have alot of health anxiety and right now i ve convinced myself i have a blood clot in my leg and i m completely freaking out i dont think there swelling and my skin color look the same but the knee im worried about ha red stretch mark on the back and the other side s are colorless idk if thats new there a sharp pain behind my left knee and i m on birth control amp i vape so i took an asprin out of fear it worth noting i also have autoimmune issue could this be an actual clot what should i do am i totally overthinking how can i tell

**Explanation:**

The individual expresses a significant level of distress and anxiety, specifically centered around health concerns. While health anxiety itself isn't necessarily indicative of depression, the language used suggests a level of impairment and emotional turmoil that pushes this beyond simple worry. Key indicators contributing to this rating include:

*   **Social Isolation:** "tbh i just have no one to talk to and really need input atm" This statement points towards a lack of social support and a feeling of being alone with their anxieties.
*   **Overwhelming Anxiety and Fear:** "i'm completely freaking out," "out of fear" suggests a state of heightened anxiety and panic. This level of emotional reactivity can be exhausting and debilitating.
*   **Rumination and Catastrophizing:** The detailed description of physical symptoms, the conviction that they have a blood clot despite lacking clear evidence, and the fear of serious consequences indicate a tendency to ruminate and catastrophize, common features in anxiety and depression.
*   **Impaired Functioning:** While not explicitly stated, the individual's anxiety is clearly impacting their ability to think clearly and self-soothe, leading them to seek external validation and reassurance.
*   **Existing Health Issues:** The mention of autoimmune issues potentially compounding anxiety and depression symptoms

The focus is on the external problem rather than internal feelings of despair.

text: going through a depressive phase probably will last for a week to the least i picked up project when i wasn t in this depressive episode and now i cut of any communication with those people a the time is passing my anxiety is rising so a to why i am not communicating what they will think judgement etc what are your thought

**Explanation:**

The text indicates several signs consistent with a moderate level of depression:

*   **Self-Identified Depressive Phase:** The individual explicitly states they are "going through a depressive phase," indicating awareness of their mood state.
*   **Anticipated Duration:** They predict the episode will last at least a week, suggesting a sustained period of low mood rather than a fleeting feeling.
*   **Impact on Functioning:** The depression is affecting their ability to engage in projects and maintain communication, indicating a disruption in normal activities.
*   **Social Withdrawal:** Cutting off communication is a common symptom of depression, reflecting a lack of motivation and potential feelings of shame or worthlessness.
*   **Anxiety and Negative Cognitions:** The rising anxiety about others' judgment reveals negative thought patterns and a preoccupation with potential social consequences, typical of depressive thinking.

While the text doesn't express suicidal ideation or complete hopelessness, the combination of low mood, functional impairment, social withdrawal, and negative cognitions points to a moderate level of depression.

text: grum wah i can t see clip must be el stupido work filter can t wait till i get a puter something else blame ex he broke mine

**Explanation:**

*   **Negative affect:** The language ("grum wah," "el stupido," "blame") suggests a negative emotional state, possibly frustration, irritability, or even anger. Such expressions are frequently observed with those experiencing depressive symptoms.
*   **Attribution of blame and external locus of control:** Blaming the "ex" for the broken computer and being hindered by a "work filter" suggests a tendency to attribute negative experiences to external factors. Individuals with depression often feel helpless and believe they lack control over their circumstances.
*   **Helplessness and frustration:** The inability to "see clip" and the dependence on having "a puter" highlight a sense of helplessness and frustration. These feelings align with the diminished motivation and loss of interest characteristic of depression.
*   **Vague and disjointed:** This can be indicative of poor concentration and cognitive difficulties, which are symptoms of moderate to severe depression.

text: doe anyone else feel the overwhelming urge to sink to the floor when their anxiety get bad like you just want to make yourself a small a possible because this ha been happening a lot to me lately i get an anxiety attack and i just want to sit a low a i can usually i m in a public space so i don t give into the urge to just sit on the public ground but when i get home it s the first thing i do to make myself feel better i don t know if that make but i figured i d put it out there
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text suggests the individual is experiencing more than just typical anxiety. While the primary focus is on anxiety attacks, the description includes elements indicative of depression:

*   **"Overwhelming urge to sink to the floor...make yourself as small as possible":** This hints at feelings of worthlessness, hopelessness, and a desire to disappear or withdraw from the world. This goes beyond just anxiety-related avoidance.
*   **"This has been happening a lot lately":** The frequency suggests a persistent issue, rather than a one-off event. This chronicity is a key feature in distinguishing a mood disorder like depression.
*   **"To make myself feel better":** This implies the individual is not feeling well to begin with and is using this action as a coping mechanism.
*   **Sharing and seeking connection:** The individual reaching out online, even tentatively ("I figured I'd put it out there"), suggests a desire for support and validation, which can often be present in individuals experiencing depression.

While the text primarily describes anxiety, the presence of feelings of hopelessness, withdrawal, and a consistent low mood warrants a rating of moderate depression.

text: i posted on the self harm sub a to why you can just look at my profile and you ll see it amp x 00b have a great day everyone
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This short text raises significant concerns and points towards severe depression due to several key indicators:

*   **Self-Harm Reference:** The explicit mention of posting on a "self-harm sub" is a strong indicator of suicidal ideation or active self-harm behaviors. This is a critical red flag.
*   **Passive Suicidal Ideation:** The phrase "you'll see it" suggests the individual feels their suffering and reasons for potential self-harm are evident and overwhelming. This can point towards suicidal ideation.
*   **Negative Outlook:** Though seemingly polite, the concluding phrase "have a great day everyone" can be a sign of detachment, or even a subtle way of saying goodbye in a person who is experiencing suicidal ideation.

text: not regularly but sometimes i experience an existential agony wash over me i am not special so i figure there are many others who feel like this hello fellow me s pre tldr maybe you can relate generally i am entirely alone with only exception being at work in an office environment and grocery shopping no friend per say the course of time swallowed those for year i had strived to achieve a normie appearance lifestyle to correct the year of abusive upbringing to my credit i am quite socially competent and financially self sufficient now but new acquaintance just don t click i figure most people have their circle worked out already and on my end i can t easily relate to inauthentic people there ha been positive relationship in my life where i experienced belonging but those each have ended negatively despite my at time to my detriment effort to make a relationship work disappointment fatigue ha accumulated to a point where i have unofficially given up my interest are vast yet spread far too thin i discover i veraciously learn about i try i fail i abandon this tends to be my cycle which additionally sediment guilt of failure rarely i will come across someone who ha those similar interest and is successfully branching into that field and i feel a kind of envy or i could have been like that feeling t h e n i remember that surviving in poisoned soil is hard enough let alone growing tall i expect a lot more of myself than wa logically possible given the circumstance in essence i can not determine if i am in a temporary plateau of development or if i am permanently stunted and will be in this grey area limbo for the rest of my day i take pride in being useful honest and finding answer and i think good karma ha gotten me a long way too hope you have a good day or better than mine atleast
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators of moderate depression. The individual describes feelings of existential agony, loneliness ("entirely alone"), and a sense of being stuck ("grey area limbo"). There's a pervasive sense of disappointment and fatigue related to relationships, leading to a passive, almost resigned attitude ("unofficially given up"). The cycle of interest, effort, failure, and abandonment further contributes to feelings of guilt and inadequacy.

While the individual acknowledges some positive aspects (social competence, financial self-sufficiency), these are overshadowed by the negative emotions and a lack of fulfillment. The comparison to "surviving in poisoned soil" and feeling "stunted" suggests a significant level of self-criticism and a perceived lack of progress. The envy towards others who are succeeding in similar fields and the questioning of whether the current state is temporary or permanent further support a moderate level of depressive symptoms.

text: simon felice is no longer playing with the felice brother i m not sure how i feel about that

The statement "simon felice is no longer playing with the felice brother i m not sure how i feel about that" suggests a few subtle indicators that warrant a rating of mild depression:

*   **Loss/Change & Uncertainty:** The statement reveals a sense of loss or change with "simon felice is no longer playing with the felice brother". Change and loss is a common symptom of depression.
*   **Emotional Ambivalence/Difficulty Processing:** The phrase "i m not sure how i feel about that" indicates some difficulty in processing emotions or a sense of emotional numbness. This can be a symptom of depression.

While the statement isn't overtly negative, the expression of uncertainty about one's feelings in response to a loss suggests a mild level of emotional distress potentially related to depression.

text: nobody ever speaks to me now

text: moving moving moving keep those box moving rawhide think i ve gone delirious from moving
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators suggesting moderate depression:

*   **Repetitive Language:** The repetition of "moving" suggests a sense of being stuck in a monotonous and possibly unwanted task. This can reflect a lack of motivation and anhedonia (loss of interest or pleasure).
*   **Sense of Overwhelm:** The phrase "keep those box moving" implies a feeling of being overwhelmed by the task at hand.
*   **Possible Cognitive Impairment:** The statement "think i ve gone delirious from moving" could point to mental fatigue, confusion, or a detachment from reality, all of which can be symptoms of depression.
*   **Monotony**: The use of "rawhide" could suggest a cowboy like moving and it could be a metaphor to the roughness that individual is experiencing in his or her life.

While the text doesn't explicitly state feelings of sadness or hopelessness, the overall tone and the specific phrases used indicate a depressed mood and a struggle to cope with the current situation. Thus the individual is experiencing moderate depression.

text: i don t mean just dating wise either i ve been rejected by my family friend and pretty much everyone else last month though i went out with a girl for v day and started dating her and very recently she said she wasn t interested in me anymore and today i found out she wa already dating another person this is the second time in a row i ve been cheated on and my suicidal thought are going crazy now i just need to type this out to calm myself down i hate this i just want someone to truly love me for once whether friend or family it feel like my whole existence wa just a mistake my life suck and i just want to die right now fuck
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This text exhibits several key indicators of severe depression:

*   **Suicidal Ideation:** The statement "my suicidal thoughts are going crazy now" and "I just want to die right now" are direct expressions of suicidal ideation, a hallmark of severe depression.
*   **Feelings of Worthlessness and Hopelessness:** The individual expresses a strong sense of worthlessness ("my whole existence was just a mistake," "my life sucks") and hopelessness ("I just want someone to truly love me for once," implying a belief that this is unattainable).
*   **Rejection Sensitivity and Relationship Issues:** The recent experiences of rejection and being cheated on have clearly exacerbated their distress, indicating a potential vulnerability to interpersonal stressors.
*   **Intense Negative Emotions:** The use of strong language ("I hate this," "fuck") suggests a high level of emotional distress and anger directed at their situation and themselves.
*   **Seeking Relief:** The act of typing this out to "calm myself down" indicates an attempt to cope with overwhelming emotions, which is common in individuals experiencing a mental health crisis.

While the individual is attempting to cope, the intensity of their negative feelings, the presence of suicidal ideation, and the feelings of worthlessness and hopelessness warrant a rating of severe depression. This person needs immediate support and intervention.

text: i m trying to think of the last time i wa genuinely bored i stay at home a lot but whenever i m not doing something and even when i m doing something i m fighting against my anxiety mentally and physically i almost can t remember the feeling of being totally neutral and looking for something to do just because almost everything i do is to reduce the feeling and effect of anxiety on my body if i watch tv it s to try and distract myself from the heart palpitation and other fun thing and to reduce anxiety eat because i know if i don t i ll feel more anxious eat junk food because i m trying to push through the anxious feeling telling me if i eat junk food i ll get sick or die post online or socialise because again i m trying to push through the feeling of anxiety i get from posting online or socialising my life is anxiety management either trying to reduce anxiety or expose myself to thing that make me anxious which feel like everything to try and reduce anxiety long term oh how i envy people who are just bored
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This text demonstrates several indicators of severe depression, intertwined with significant anxiety. The individual describes a pervasive state of anxiety that dominates their daily life. Key indicators include:

*   **Loss of Interest/Anhedonia:** The inability to recall a time of genuine boredom suggests a lack of interest or pleasure in activities.
*   **Constant Anxiety:** The individual is in a perpetual state of fighting anxiety, both mentally and physically. This points towards a significant disruption in their ability to function normally.
*   **Anxiety-Driven Behaviors:** Their actions (watching TV, eating, socializing) are solely motivated by anxiety management rather than genuine enjoyment or need. This highlights the extent to which anxiety controls their life.
*   **Feelings of Hopelessness/Envy:** Envy towards those who experience boredom suggests a longing for a normal, anxiety-free existence, implying a sense of hopelessness about their own situation.
*   **Physical Symptoms:** The mention of heart palpitations indicates the presence of physical symptoms associated with anxiety, further impacting their well-being.

The combination of these factors points to a severe level of depression, where anxiety is a major component, significantly impairing their daily life and overall sense of well-being.

text: my parent have never really cared about what i m doing online because they trust me to be safe plus i am a teenager so i know about internet safety and stuff which is good because i don t like my parent knowing what i do online and it not think in doing anything bad i just don t like my parent knowing i don t even want them to know what show i watch i don t know why this is but recently i ve started blocking my bedroom door with my chair my room is very small so all i have to do is wheel my chair back slightly to block it and when my mum come in she always asks me why i ve blocked my door and then she asks if it because i m watching naughty thing she doe always asks this in a joking way but it make me uncomfortable i just don t know how to tell her how uncomfortable it make me so any advice with telling her would help me a lot

**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators that suggest mild depression:

*   **Emotional Discomfort and Avoidance:** The individual expresses discomfort with their mother's jokes and difficulty communicating their feelings. This avoidance and emotional discomfort can be linked to depression.
*   **Unexplained Irritability:** The individual's annoyance at their mother's question, even if meant in jest, coupled with the inability to articulate why, can be symptomatic of underlying emotional distress.
*   **Possible Low Self-Esteem/Shame:** While subtle, the concern that the mother thinks they might be watching "naughty things" and the associated discomfort could suggest a sensitivity to judgment and potential feelings of shame or inadequacy.

While these are concerning, the individual is seeking advice, indicating some degree of engagement and a desire to improve the situation. There are no explicit statements of hopelessness, worthlessness, or suicidal ideation, which would suggest a more severe level of depression. Therefore, a rating of 1 (Mild Depression) is the most appropriate based on the provided text.

i have it now i know i get it really bad the longer i m in my head the next part is the backstory and i would like your guy opinion on what to do so there this girl in college that i absolutely adore we have the same major and we graduate in may i ve known her for about year and i told her how i felt and asked her out in december i didn t know she just gotten out of a relationship so she said she wasn t ready for one and she needed some time to get in the right mindset she told our mutual friend about and told her that s the only reason she didn t say yes the next part i completely screwed up i never told her that i wa waiting for her i wanted to but would chicken out i wa planning on texting her every couple of day but personal stuff came up and i thought some of it would be to heavy of a subject matter to talk with her about like my grandmother being on death s door so i didn t really sayuch during our winter break also this is when i really started to get in my head i would just imagine all these different scenario and date with her and it just made me anxious and i didn t know how to stop them then by the time i worked up the courage to figure through my anxiety to tell her some different stuff like i m willing to wait for her that i appreciated a certain day and how she made special to me and how i feel like a very closed person and i wanted to open up with her she got in a relationship and i don t blame her i blame myself because looking at it from her point of view it seems like i wa not interested in her anymore also just want to insert that she know i care for her when she had covid i checked up on her everyday since then i been having what i think are panic attack i will have the shortness of breath and my hand will start shaking uncontrollably and recently i will also have some chest pain with it before she got the relationship i started going to counseling to try to improve my mental health to let you know how i feel about this person she make me feel like no else ha ever done before my feeling gor her are so intense and i ve tried to move on but the feeling get stronger she belief in me more than i so myself plus my heart think she might be the one which i know is crazy she s the most important person in the world to me and i don t want to lose her after graduating here lately i feel like i been acting strange around and it s because of this anxiety so my question is do i tell her what i m going through i feel like this will help with my anxiety and give her some insight to why i ve been acting the way i been how much do i tell her i feel if i don t tell her my anxiety will keep on getting worse and i probably won t be able to actually have a conversation with her the rest of the school year and we might drift apart after graduation i would still like to be friend with her after graduation thank you for reading this also i don t know if this is the right community for this but i would really value your opinion
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The individual's text exhibits several indicators of moderate depression:

*   **Self-Reported Depression and Anxiety:** The individual explicitly states having depression and anxiety, which have worsened recently.
*   **Triggers and Rumination:** The situation with the girl in college is a clear trigger, leading to excessive rumination ("getting in my head," imagining scenarios) and increased anxiety.
*   **Physical Symptoms:** The presence of panic attack symptoms (shortness of breath, shaking, chest pain) is a significant indicator of distress.
*   **Negative Self-Blame and Low Self-Esteem:** The individual blames themselves for the situation ("I blame myself") and expresses feelings of inadequacy ("she believes in me more than I do myself").
*   **Intense Feelings and Hopelessness:** The intense feelings for the girl, coupled with the fear of losing her and drifting apart, contribute to a sense of hopelessness.
*   **Seeking Help:** The individual is seeking advice and has started counseling, indicating an awareness of their mental health struggles.

While the individual is functional and attending college, the intensity of their emotions, the presence of panic attack symptoms, and the impact on their daily life suggest a moderate level of depression. A mild depression may not include panic attack like symptoms. Severe depression would include more symptoms that are impacting day to day functioning. Therefore, the text does not rise to the level of severe depression.

text: man did i had a wacky dream this early morning loggin here look like at is spamming me with update

**Explanation:**

The text excerpt is short and lacks significant detail, making a definitive assessment challenging. However, there are subtle indicators that suggest a possible, mild depressive state:

*   **"Wacky dream this early morning":** While not explicitly negative, this could hint at disrupted sleep, which is a common symptom of depression. It can also point to racing thoughts or anxiety that manifests in dreams.
*   **"Loggin here look like at is spamming me with update":** This could be interpreted as the individual feeling overwhelmed or burdened by simple tasks (logging in, dealing with updates). Depression can lead to decreased motivation and a sense of being burdened by everyday responsibilities.

**Important Considerations:**

*   **Context is crucial:** A single text snippet is not sufficient for a diagnosis. More information about the person's overall mood, behavior, and history is necessary.
*   **Mild indicators:** The signs are subtle and could be due to other factors (e.g., stress, lack of sleep, personality). Therefore, the "Mild Depression" rating is a preliminary assessment.
*   **Professional Evaluation:** This analysis is not a substitute for a comprehensive evaluation by a qualified mental health professional.

text: i stood up for myself about not being credited for artwork used by my school and now somehow that ha lead to a teacher talking about me to my peer behind my back and me being harassed by a woman who work for the school on their drama production i contacted my principal and he ha not responded my mom say if i go to anyone higher up i will get in trouble i feel trapped everyone hate me now and the rest of my school year is going to be horrible i feel like the only way to fix this situation is to die i fucked everything up

*   **Feelings of Hopelessness and Helplessness:** The individual expresses a sense of being "trapped" and that "the rest of my school year is going to be horrible." This reflects a profound sense of hopelessness about the future.

The presence of suicidal ideation, combined with the other symptoms, strongly suggests a severe level of depression requiring immediate intervention and support.

*   **Anhedonia and lack of motivation:** The individual describes a "lack of feeling" and an inability to focus or get things done, including essential tasks like waking up on time for work and eating meals. They express a desire to pursue personal goals (going back to school) but feel overwhelmed by the demands of daily life.

*   **Feelings of Worthlessness/Burden:** The statement "I don't want to bother anyone" and "it must be a horrible thing to hear from someone" suggests feelings of being a burden and negative self-perception, which are common in depression.
*   **Hopelessness:** The phrase "there's nothing they can do really" and "I'm not sure what I can do at this point either" conveys a sense of hopelessness and a lack of perceived solutions or support.
*   **Desperation:** The concluding statement "I'm just so desperate" underscores the intensity of the individual's emotional pain and their feeling of being trapped.

While they claim they don't have a proper plan, the presence of persistent suicidal thoughts coupled with feelings of worthlessness, hopelessness, and desperation points to a significant level of severity. They should seek professional help immediately.

text: seamonkey i am on a healthy eating kick i could only have shetland pony
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The statement, "seamonkey i am on a healthy eating kick i could only have shetland pony" is quite unusual and suggests a few potential issues related to depression:

*   **Bizarre or illogical thought process:** The comparison between a healthy eating kick and being limited to eating a Shetland pony doesn't make logical sense. This could be indicative of cognitive difficulties often associated with depression, such as difficulty concentrating or thinking clearly.
*   **Anhedonia/Loss of Interest:** The statement may express the hopelessness that they cannot enjoy life outside of a restrictive diet.
*   **Loss of motivation:** "i am on a healthy eating kick i could only have shetland pony" suggests that the individual feels forced to maintain a restrictive diet.

While this single statement isn't enough for a definitive diagnosis, the noted issues justify a rating of moderate depression.

*   **Persistent negative mood:** "Still feel like hell" suggests a continuation of a depressed or very low mood. The individual is not feeling any improvement.
*   **Hopelessness/Pessimism:** The phrase "why am I always ill when I take time off work" can indicate the individual has a negative view of the world and feels like they have bad luck.

While the individual acknowledges a slight improvement ("maybe not as bad as yesterday"), the overall tone is still significantly negative and indicative of moderate depressive symptoms.

text: http t co vb0egkkj best way to cure depression naturally just wake up early depression bealive anxiety focus brain bestadvice youtubevideo
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This tweet-like text exhibits a few indicators that suggest mild depression:

*   **Oversimplification of Treatment:** The phrase "just wake up early" as a "best way to cure depression naturally" demonstrates a significant underestimation of the complexity of depression. This can be a sign that the individual may be experiencing symptoms of depression but is in denial of the severity.
*   **Keywords:** The presence of the words "depression" and "anxiety" are direct indicators that the individual may be suffering from these conditions.
*   **Seeking Solutions:** The mention of "best advice" and "YouTube video" suggests the individual may be searching for solutions or guidance, which is common when someone is struggling.
*   **Focus:** The individual seems to be struggling with their ability to focus, which is another symptom of depression.

The rating is mild because the text is short and lacks detailed personal experiences. It is more indicative of someone searching for information or trying to give simplistic advice, rather than expressing deep-seated despair. However, the inclusion of key terms associated with depression and anxiety warrants a rating above zero.

text: depressed college student checking in i literally get 9 hour of sleep every single night i dont drink or abuse substance and am in good shape for the love of god i can not get my as out of bed i seriously cant im having really poor attendance issue becayse of this i hate what i do i see no point in all of this struggle to just fuckin exist all this hell i go thru debt stress and burnout is all so i can have a chance at a shit show 9 job my school love to make life unnecessarily hard to keep student from graduatin on time so they can suck more ane more from u getting out of bed is my biggest challenge it all full circle im depressed i dont like what i do and i dont feel that what im doing is effective i m anxious about my future and dont know what to do about it all i look forward to doing is sleeping eating is a chore showering is a chore being awake is a hassle the cost of existance ha won it beat the life outta me
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This text excerpt demonstrates several key indicators of severe depression:

*   **Anhedonia and Loss of Interest:** The individual explicitly states "I hate what I do," "I see no point in all of this struggle," and describes previously enjoyable activities like eating and showering as chores. There is a clear lack of pleasure or motivation in daily life.
*   **Sleep Disturbances:** While they report getting 9 hours of sleep, this could be a sign of hypersomnia, which is common in depression, where the individual sleeps excessively as a way to escape or cope. The core issue is that they can't get out of bed.
*   **Fatigue and Lack of Energy:** "I can not get my as out of bed" is a strong indicator of profound fatigue and a lack of energy, even despite getting sufficient sleep. They also describe being "beat the life outta me" which is a sign of fatigue.
*   **Feelings of Hopelessness and Worthlessness:** The individual expresses a bleak outlook on the future ("chance at a shit show 9 job"), feelings of being overwhelmed by life's challenges ("all this hell I go thru debt stress and burnout"), and a sense of being defeated by existence. This paints a picture of hopelessness.
*   **Anxiety about the Future:** The statement "I'm anxious about my future and don't know what to do about it all" indicates a significant level of worry and uncertainty, which can exacerbate depressive symptoms.
*   **Self-Identification as Depressed:** The individual directly states "I'm depressed," indicating a self-awareness of their condition.
*   **Functional Impairment:** The poor attendance issue clearly indicates that their depression is significantly impacting their ability to function in their daily life (academically).
*   **Sense of Helplessness and Being Trapped:** The individual describes a feeling of being trapped in a cycle ("it all full circle") and expresses frustration with their situation and feelings of being overwhelmed by external pressures (school policies, cost of existence).

The combination of these factors, along with the intensity of the language used, suggests a severe level of depression that is significantly impacting the individual's well-being and daily functioning. It is critical that this individual seek professional mental health support.

text: i cant bear not being beatiful im a man not girl i just can t i cant begin to process how i myself and be le beatiful im gon na die soon but i havent quiited my job i make good saving each month i have some other bunch of saved money how can i have some clean fun no s x no drug or should i try to help others gift food school supply clothes to those who need it i know i can donate my eyeball and no one will care because my face isnt beatiful beauty of the face is literally what made human conciousness how do i face the use of money since i wont be needing it in old age which ill never reach
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This text exhibits several indicators of severe depression:

*   **Hopelessness and Suicidal Ideation:** The statement "I'm gonna die soon" suggests suicidal thoughts or a belief that death is imminent. The individual also expresses a deep sense of hopelessness about their future ("which I'll never reach").
*   **Self-Loathing and Body Image Issues:** The obsession with not being "beautiful" and the intense negative self-perception ("i cant bear not being beatiful," "my face isnt beatiful") indicate significant self-esteem issues and potentially body dysmorphic concerns. The statement "beauty of the face is literally what made human conciousness" shows delusional thinking.
*   **Loss of Interest/Anhedonia:** While not explicitly stated, the question "how can I have some clean fun no s x no drug" suggests a struggle to find enjoyment in activities, possibly due to anhedonia (the inability to experience pleasure).
*   **Existential Concerns and Detachment:** The preoccupation with the purpose of money and the belief that "no one will care" if they donate their eyeball indicates a detachment from others and a grappling with existential questions in the context of their perceived lack of worth.
*   **Contradictory Behaviors:** While expressing suicidal ideation, the individual also mentions continuing to work and save money. This can be a sign of depression, as individuals may struggle with conflicting desires to end their life while also clinging to aspects of normalcy.
*   **Agitation and Impairment:** The writing style is disorganized, which can indicate agitation and cognitive impairment due to depression.

text: i don t know how much longer i m gon na wait could be a few day or a couple week or month definitely by the end of the year though it all depends on if it get even worse and how much worse it get if it get better then i won t do it but i don t see that happening given the pattern it s like every month i lose someone else every day i get a bigger workload and enjoy the thing i like a little le i m an alcoholic and i m not even old enough to drink i ve promised it to myself so many time because it s comforting feeling like the way out is close even if it s not happening but this time is different this time i really don t think i can go on maybe i m just a baby maybe i m over dramatic maybe i m a piece of shit who deserves to die or deserves to live miserable it doesn t matter anymore the reason i have aren t gon na go away or get better just because people tell me they aren t good reason sorry to everyone i m glad i made a new account so they won t see this specific post at least i m probably gon na post the note to instagram right a it s happening just so it s out there and people know and i don t just disappear from everything and leave anyone worrying
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text excerpt exhibits several critical indicators of extreme depression and a high risk of suicide. These include:

*   **Suicidal Ideation with a Plan:** The individual explicitly states they don't think they can go on and reference a specific timeline and conditions ("by the end of the year," depending on whether things get better or worse). They also mention planning to post a note on Instagram. This shows intent and planning.
*   **Hopelessness and Helplessness:** The individual expresses a deep sense of hopelessness, stating that things are not going to get better and that their reasons for feeling this way are not going to change. They feel trapped and see no way out.
*   **Self-Loathing and Worthlessness:** The individual uses self-deprecating language ("maybe i'm just a baby," "maybe i'm over dramatic," "maybe i'm a piece of shit who deserves to die"). This indicates a significant lack of self-worth.
*   **Loss of Interest and Pleasure:** They mention enjoying the things they like "a little le[ss]", which aligns with the symptoms of depression (anhedonia).
*   **Substance Abuse:** The mention of being an alcoholic (even though underage) suggests self-medication to cope with the emotional pain.
*   **Social Isolation:** The creation of a new account to post anonymously indicates a desire to hide their feelings from people they know, suggesting social isolation and a feeling of being alone in their struggles.
*   **Sense of Burden to Others:** Apologizing to everyone also suggests that the individual feels that they are a burden to those around them.

These factors, taken together, demonstrate a severe level of depression and immediate concern for the individual's safety.

i m broken down and i wan na be a kid again with my favorite stuffed animal maybe just take a nap and then i ll wake up and be okay
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This text exhibits several critical indicators of extreme depression:

*   **Suicidal Ideation:** The statement "I really think I should just kill myself" is a direct expression of suicidal thoughts, a hallmark of severe depression and a critical risk factor.
*   **Intense Self-Loathing and Guilt:** The individual expresses intense self-hatred ("I really hate myself"), refers to themself as a "monster," and believes they don't deserve to live. This level of self-condemnation is characteristic of profound depression.
*   **Hopelessness and Worthlessness:** The individual feels that nothing they do can fix their reputation, that they don't deserve a normal life, and that their life has always been defined by trauma. This pervasive sense of hopelessness and worthlessness is a core symptom of depression.
*   **Emotional Pain and Distress:** The text is saturated with feelings of sorrow, regret, and confusion. The individual's statement that they are "broken down" and wish to return to childhood suggests a profound desire to escape their current reality and emotional pain.
*   **Anhedonia and Loss of Identity:** The individual's uncertainty about who they are ("I can't tell who I am anymore") and their inability to find pleasure or meaning in life indicate a loss of identity and anhedonia, both common symptoms of depression.
*   **Past Trauma and Substance Abuse:** While not direct indicators, the history of trauma, substance abuse, and the individual's acknowledgement of harmful past behaviors further suggest a complex interplay of factors contributing to their current state of extreme distress and depression.

text: i wa suffering from walking up in the morning in absolute terror not long after starting this that ha subsided but now when i take this when i go to bed if i don t fall asleep within 0 min i get racing thought and confusion and none of the thought make any sense a in they are not logical doe anyone else have these issue trying to figure out if it s the drug or me
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text excerpt suggests the individual is experiencing symptoms consistent with moderate depression. Here's why:

*   **Terror Upon Waking:** The statement "suffering from waking up in the morning in absolute terror" is a significant indicator. This suggests a high level of anxiety and dread associated with daily life, a common symptom of depression.
*   **Racing Thoughts and Confusion:** The individual describes "racing thoughts and confusion" when they can't fall asleep. These racing thoughts lack logical coherence, pointing to a disturbed mental state. This cognitive disorganization is often observed in individuals with depression and anxiety disorders.
*   **Uncertainty and Self-Doubt:** The phrase "trying to figure out if it's the drug or me" demonstrates a level of uncertainty and self-doubt. This questioning of one's self and attributing negative experiences to internal factors can be a symptom of depression.
*   **Impact on Sleep:** The experiences are directly impacting the individual's sleep, suggesting the symptoms are intrusive and disruptive to their daily functioning.

While the initial terror has subsided somewhat, the persistence of racing thoughts, confusion, and the impact on sleep patterns points towards a moderate level of depressive symptoms. It is important to consider that this is a preliminary assessment based on a limited text excerpt and a full clinical evaluation is needed for an accurate diagnosis.

text: i used to enjoy posting and just interacting with people but now i can t bring myself to open it up it s just awful seeing post and post of people just living while i m just existing stagnant it all feel so counterfeit
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators of moderate depression:

*   **Anhedonia:** The individual expresses a loss of interest and pleasure in activities they previously enjoyed ("used to enjoy posting and just interacting...but now I can't bring myself"). This is a core symptom of depression.
*   **Social Withdrawal:** The individual avoids social interaction ("can't bring myself to open it up"). This is a common behavior in depressed individuals.
*   **Negative Social Comparison:** The individual compares themself unfavorably to others ("awful seeing post and post of people just living while I'm just existing"). This comparison fuels feelings of inadequacy and hopelessness.
*   **Feelings of Emptiness/Stagnation:** The statement "I'm just existing stagnant" suggests a lack of purpose and feeling stuck in life.
*   **Feelings of Inauthenticity:** The phrase "it all feel so counterfeit" suggests a sense of disconnect from the world and a feeling that things are not genuine or meaningful.

While the individual expresses clear depressive symptoms, the language doesn't indicate imminent self-harm or a complete inability to function. Therefore, a moderate rating seems most appropriate.

text: i miss jesus i miss the warmth warmth of the graspclasped onto me with both handsholy hand holding hand hold my handi remember i surrender to falsity and ill conceived connotation taught to believe misinformation that my purpose wa purposeful but it s all for man s profitand the only true prophet is the soothsayerand the soothsayer is an entity of many layersa coterie educates on blanket of misconceptionblanket me so i ll be warm full and fret freedisrobe me so i ll be broken open and emptyall i take is blue pill to calm mebut all i really intake is falsitythese line are just stanza so do a you willlife demand a mind of stabilitynot insanity but insane is written all over meso take your fake pill and snort up these linesor waste it all get ill and snort white lineswhite lie won t kill right get wasted don t wake up just wait for you to fucking taste itit s never enoughtake your blind pleasure freedom and delight it your birthrightfree will do a you willbut think twice before they put you on the spotlight because once they have you chained up you convert into a cenobite with no change you secure your own chainsand if you re unbothered call me deranged may a well fasten the rope and stay restrained no one s going to save you except the latter so choose a life of false glamour or have it shatterthe pain is worth itonce you re open you can truly observe it unlearn it be free from the cage or stay locked in and fall into the greyits all a fucking rat race
explanation:
**Explanation:**

This text exhibits several indicators of severe depression:

*   **Loss of Faith and Purpose:** The individual expresses a profound sense of disillusionment with religion ("i miss jesus," "misinformation that my purpose wa purposeful but it s all for man s profit"). This loss of faith and purpose is a common symptom of depression.
*   **Hopelessness and Helplessness:** Phrases like "no one's going to save you" and "stay restrained" convey a sense of hopelessness and a belief that escape from their current state is impossible.
*   **Self-Destructive Thoughts/Behaviors:** The mention of "white lines," "get wasted don't wake up," and "fasten the rope" suggests self-destructive thoughts and potential engagement in substance abuse as a coping mechanism.
*   **Sense of Being Trapped:** The imagery of being "chained up," "convert into a cenobite," and "locked in" points to a feeling of being trapped and unable to break free from their suffering.
*   **Self-Loathing:** The lines "insane is written all over me" and "call me deranged" indicate a strong sense of self-loathing and negative self-perception.
*   **Desire for Escape:** The references to pills, both blue and white, and the desire to be "blanket[ed]...warm full and fret free" suggest a strong desire to escape from their current emotional state.
*   **Anhedonia:** The mention of "fake pill" and "blind pleasure freedom and delight" imply that the individual is not truly experiencing joy or pleasure, a condition known as anhedonia which is common in individuals with depression.
*   **Ruminating Thoughts:** The repetitive and cyclical nature of the thoughts, especially the return to themes of falsity, entrapment, and self-destruction, suggests a pattern of rumination which is common in depression.

While the text is somewhat fragmented and uses metaphorical language, the underlying themes of despair, hopelessness, self-loathing, and a desire for escape strongly suggest a severe level of depression.

text: so me and my boyfriend met at we were friend for yr first we had the same grade in school and got into the same top university fast forward to our final year at university my boyfriend take a different major to me he is getting top grade and had a great job lined after he graduate i on the other hand have completely given up on life i gave up learning to drive seeing my friend going to class i m probably not graduating i gave up on wanting to do something with my art aswell i spent my last year physically and mentally ill i worked so many hour a a a waitress because my family are really low on money but ive even given up on working a lot he s just more bubbly and smart compared to me he s also not a poor a i am he s just better than me
explanation:
**Explanation:**

The text exhibits several indicators of severe depression:

*   **Loss of Interest and Pleasure (Anhedonia):** The individual explicitly states they have "completely given up on life," "gave up learning to drive," "seeing my friend," "going to class," and "given up on wanting to do something with my art." This pervasive loss of interest and pleasure in previously enjoyed activities is a core symptom of depression.
*   **Feelings of Worthlessness and Guilt:** The individual expresses strong feelings of inadequacy and self-blame by stating "he's just better than me." The comparison to her boyfriend, highlighting his success and her perceived failures, fuels these feelings.
*   **Fatigue and Low Energy:** The statement "spent my last year physically and mentally ill" and the context of working long hours as a waitress suggest significant fatigue and a lack of energy.
*   **Academic and Occupational Impairment:** The individual acknowledges they are "probably not graduating" and have "even given up on working a lot," indicating significant impairment in academic and occupational functioning.
*   **Hopelessness:** The overall tone of the text conveys a sense of hopelessness and a lack of belief in a positive future. The phrase "completely given up on life" encapsulates this feeling.
*   **Financial Stress:** The stress due to her family's financial condition is adding to the person's depression.
These factors, combined with the individual's subjective experience of giving up, suggest a level of depression that is significantly impacting their daily life and well-being, warranting a rating of severe.

text: i already called in yesterday for work i wa up all night laying here just awake counting down the hour to work wa so exhausted by the time work came around that i called in and even then i couldn t sleep it s now 0 pm and i ve gotten under an hour of sleep in the last 0 hr i m starting to worry a bit this month ha been so hard for me i literally almost walked into traffic on the way to work last week been cry so much i m so alone and it really scare me because i m going through all of this by myself

The combination of these factors, especially the mention of nearly walking into traffic, points towards a severe level of depression requiring immediate attention.

text: im talking about the kind of depressive episode where you lay in bed all day for day week and struggle to find energy motivation for simple functioning such a eating and showering just lay sit there having negative thought and feeling hopeless useless and pathetic i have these episode a few or so time a year my question is do you generally have something in your mind that feel like the obstacle you need to cross to start the process of getting out of your depressive episode for example sometimes for me i just feel like if only i could completely clean my house i d start to feel better other time it might be something else on my to do list or a few thing i feel are the obstacle to feeling better the obstacle always seem insanely mundane but also impossible to do in my state a if i d have to put on a ton of body weight and get up and do it with all that extra weight and already feeling fatigued it bizarre because ive noticed over the year that completing whatever it is that i ve decided a my obstacle is generally the st step to leaving my major depressive episode i can t describe the mental workout it is to get something done sometimes though like i may attempt to get it done time in a week to just end up giving up and going back to bed i m just wondering if anyone else get this and set up hurdle type thing for themselves when they are super depressive and do you ever eventually complete your obstacle amp doe it help you to coming out of the episode
